definition: follow the prescribed order/keep to conventional ways
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: Relief supplies now are regularly being flown into Rangoon.
sentences.chinese: 救援物资现在能按步就班地运抵仰光。

sentences.english: A foreign language cannot be learned rapidly; it must be learned step by step.
sentences.chinese: 学外语不能急，只能按步就班地学。

definition: to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
a wooden word-by-word reading

definition: hidebound by convention (idiom)
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable

everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
